events.message: The customer reported an auto accident involving their vehicle and filed the initial claim.
The claim was categorized as an auto accident after reviewing the initial accident report.
An agent specialized in auto accident claims was assigned to assist the customer promptly.
The customer received acknowledgment that their auto accident claim is now being processed.
The adjuster requested the police report, photos of vehicle damage, and repair estimates.
The customer submitted all requested documents including the police report and repair quotes.
Investigators began reviewing the evidence and witness statements related to the collision.
The investigation was completed and liability was determined for the auto accident claim.
A settlement amount was proposed based on the damage evaluation and policy terms.
The customer provided positive feedback regarding the fast communication during claim settlement.
The insurance company approved the claim payout following the customer's acceptance of settlement.
The approved settlement payment was issued to the customerâ€™s account without delay.
The claim was closed after confirmation that payment was received and the customer was satisfied.
The auto accident claim file was archived for record-keeping and future reference purposes.
